column4: hello; after installing ubuntu on another partition, i can't see that drive if i'm using windows xp; can anyone help? thanks
There is nothing wrong. Windows XP can't see ext3 file volumes. there are third-party programs for windows that you can use, but you would need to google to find them.
yes, using various programs like Partition Magic or just use the gparted boot disk
you are aware that from ubuntu, you can see your windows xp volume right?
i don't know why you would want to
gparted is free and open source and runs on a linux build on the cd
i'll save you the decision making process, just use gparted.
if installing anything newer than windows XP, check out item #14 here before doing so (print it out) http://gparted.sourceforge.net/faq.php
just to save you a common headache
really it's easier than falling off a log with gparted, just read the instructions, the menu will guide you
if you have any problems with windows xp booting look at #13 on the same link i gave you a moment ago
i am assuming you are wanting to expand out your windows volume too, gparted lets you do that as well
ok thanks i'll go read up about gparted and how to use it
ok great, it's really not very difficult, read the FAQ too
you didn't say that you wanted it to be NTFS
you simply said you wanted to format it
thats what you get for not giving enough information
